place_description: Coffee Republic in Ballantyne Village is the best coffee shop near you! Enjoy artisanal coffee, fresh pastries, and a welcoming ambiance. Whether grabbing a quick cup or relaxing with friends, our café is your go-to spot for quality coffee and treats.

reviews_data.review_text: Stopped by for first time on 4/1 in the afternoon. Super friendly Barista and an amazing caramel latte! Will be back

Great coffee! Highly recommend the Macchiato small and strong how it should be!

Staff are nice and alive.

As Coffee Republic finds their footing it is great to see the improvements each visit.  They have created a chic, inviting and chill environment with the layout and decor.  The menu is vast which invites experimentation, which the baristas stand behind by offering suggestions and re-dos.
I really like their food options and it seems they are getting better at the speed oven.  My first experience was a cold egg sandwich, but ever since it's been steaming.  The Chili Verde wrap is a fun addition that brings some flavor to breakfast.
I think everything is moving in the right direction and this will continue to be in my rotation of morning delights.
Cappuccino was good.
Super friendly staff and delicious breakfast sandwich and coffee. Oh, and the peanut butter cookie! Just get one!

Didn't realize it was a chain, but should that have mattered? Walked in and felt the chain store vibes. But what was unacceptable was a bare pastry case and empty store at 8am. They were out of the one breakfast sandwich I asked for. I got another and it was a Starbucks-style reheat that was still cold in the middle And when I asked if my coffee could be in a mug they shot that down because their mugs were too small. Coffee tasted decent. Was planning to camp out all morning and work but just wanted to leave. So I did.

Hi, Each time I have patronized this establishment my drink selection was great. The staff always polite.  Yesterday, 2.14.25 I had the pleasure of meeting a GM. He had patience and help me figure out my order. He was so kind a down to earth.  We spoke briefly about the number of locations the company has. I hate I didn't ask his name. "You know who you are"....lol As a coffee lover, I frequent coffee shops daily, and Coffee Republic is one of my favorite places around. See you soon.... Thank you!
Nice place. Good food and good coffee. Pleasant bar, table or upstairs ambiance. Something for all of my moods.

This is one of my go-to working spots. It's small and cozy, making it great to focus, and also not too loud (especially the loft area). I've also attended events there on topics like self-care, which was incredible.
I am not a coffee drinker, but their smoothies are incredible! I was with a group of 6 and the service was excellent. Nice intimate atmosphere

I have been there several times & the service has been great & I love the camomile tea with steamed lemonade. The stafff has been very accommodating.

Most recently, I held a self-care workshop in the loft area. It is just the right size for my workshops with the right amount of tables & seating AND privacy!! Looking forward to holding the next one March 25th!

Thank you to the owners, Kalea, for her hospitality & warm personality & allow use to use the space!
Warmly,
Rita 
Simple Self-Care by Rita

One of the best tasting coffees I've had in the area. I love the vegan energy balls too! And always the sweetest baristas! The location in Matthews gives cute small town vibes which I've missed since moving here!

The rise of the Coffee Republic began in the shadow of a once-dominant force: the Tea Kingdom. For centuries, the world had been steeped in tea culture, where a single monarch and an elite class of tea sommeliers dictated the brewing methods and flavors enjoyed by the people. But discontent simmered beneath the surface. The common coffee farmers, tired of the rigid traditions and the overwhelming dominance of tea, sought a new system--one where every coffee drinker had a voice.

In a bold move, the coffee farmers, roasters, and baristas overthrew the last Tea King, spilling his finest Darjeeling and dismantling the monarchy. In its place, they established the Coffee Republic, a system where cafe owners, bean merchants, and skilled baristas could all participate in the governance of their coffee trade. Instead of a single ruler, power was shared among elected coffee consuls and a council of esteemed roasters, ensuring that no single blend dominated the market.

The early years of the Coffee Republic were filled with struggle. Rival cafe syndicates often clashed, and there were constant battles over the best brewing techniques. But through perseverance, innovation, and the unwavering belief that coffee was meant to be enjoyed by all, the republic flourished.

Expanding beyond its original cafes, the Coffee Republic pushed into new territories, offering superior roasting methods and advanced espresso technology. Over time, its influence spread, and coffee drinkers from all regions embraced the new order. Though the road was filled with challenges, the rise of the Coffee Republic marked a turning point in history, ensuring that never again would the world be ruled by a single tea-drinking elite. Instead, a new age of rich, bold coffee had begun.
Love this place...it has a great atmosphere...friendly staff and one of the best chai latte's I've had!!
Great coffee spot! Also a great meeting spot to meet clients, co workers etc.
Coffee was good but expensive!

I'm really bummed to write a poor review, because I like their coffees and their space, but the wait times have been ridiculous for online orders. I ordered online before my lunch break, and 30 mins later nothing was ready. There were a few customers in person, so I waited until there was no line at all and no one coming in to ask about my food/drink. They checked the order, started making my drink, but told me that the food I ordered was not available. I was on my lunch break, and just got out of two anesthetic procedures. I was so tired and needed to eat. I ended up having to walk somewhere else for food and was late back to work. I really want to like this place, but this experience has been very consistent.

Very odd interaction today with the shorter white girl with short black curly hair.  I almost thought she was high or something.  She brought me over my drink and I said thank you and then she states again what the drink is which was odd because I already said thank you.  And then she goes to her coworker and said something about why did I bother and something about she only said thank you or didn't say thank you. I couldn't quite tell but it was unnecessary and rude.  I wasn't mean to them so I don't get it.  She just seemed out of it.  I never had this interaction here before but it was weird.   Normally the workers seem more normal.
The best quiche I've ever had. The inside is small but cozy; a nice place to study, read, or chat with friends.
Coffee was great and ready quickly. Food prep was slow and had to follow up as it wasn't even being prepared several minutes after we got our coffee.

I typically purchase coffee 3-4 days a week from Starbucks.. I live in the village and would prefer to visit you more frequently but your coffee and food prices are too high. Also there should be no  up charge for plant based milks.

The chai latte is good, the reheated pastries and sandwiches are good, but stop asking for tips when you don't actually serve the food. Keep in mind, the lowest pre-selected tip amount is 15% and goes up to 25%. Serve the food and it might be worth a tip.
the girl with short curly brown hair is really cute.
Every time I'm there it's a wonderful experience! I am so indecisive, but they are patient and give me great recommendations :))) you gotta stop here if you're in the area, you won't regret it!

I go nowhere else except Coffee Republic for my espresso or matcha drinks anymore and my husband LOVES their black eye drink (same as a red eye but extra espresso). The breakfast sandwiches and cookies are amazing (I haven't tried the other foods yet but keep eyeing the red velvet muffin!) and we love the atmosphere. Every single barista has been amazing, especially Irina!
Literally my favorite coffee shop. The coffee is amazing, food is delicious, and the people are awesome. Love this place!!

I absolutely LOVE this coffee shop. They put this new location in Ballantyne Village recently, & it's right around the corner from me now! Quite literally addictive. I get a PB energy bar almost every day. My recent favorite has been their Ultimate Chai, made with vanilla and cardamom, from their fall menu. I also love their coffee and matcha, & love to get a strawberry cold foam on top!! I've honestly never had a bad drink from here! The employees are so kind, warm, & welcoming, & it's such a cute place to hangout, work on your computer, chat with a friend, or meet someone new!
Ordered through Uber Eats. Everything was cancelled because it was sold out. No communication from them at all. Terrible service. Wanted to support this place but nope. Never again

I am a big fan of the other Coffee Republic locations but unfortunately in comparison this one just isn't as good. The space is cool for sure. However the service was somewhat rude, the wait was very long, and when I got my drink it was made incorrectly. I was given different milk than what I asked for and was upcharged for it and the flavor I asked for wasn't put in. It's not the worst but I would likely go to other locations before this one.
Good coffee. Nice variety of specialty drinks. Service is hit or miss. Some awesome employees and some that seem like I am bothering them coming in, but the coffee is one of the best.
My coffee drink was absolutely delicious as wall the French toast muffin I had. It was huge! No way could I eat it in one sitting. Prices were reasonable for what you got.
Nice place with a overhead loft with extra seating. Only complaint is that a small block coffee is over $4.  $20 at a place around the corner gets unlimited for a month.
Very nice and personable service.
Good coffe, nice folks. Unique compared to a usual chain. But expensive!

Service was adequate but not great.  Only one person to take and fill orders.    Coffee was not great... weak and little flavor.  I tossed the second half.  Also a little expensive,  especially considering what it is.  Place is noisy and cramped.
Steep prices but not a great set of options or good service
Went here on a weekend day morning. Great ambiance with good seating upstairs. Ambiance was great to sit and get some focused work done

Great place for a coffee and pastry, I love that they also have sandwich and alternative milk options. The staff is friendly and helpful and answered my questions.  I had coffee and a cinnamon twist and my daughter had the iced salty dog latte with a French toast muffin, they were delicious,  we 'll be back!

It has an UPSTAIRS!  The cutest and most customer friendly coffee shop in town, with lots to offer.

The food and the drinks are great.
- Spinache Sausage Feta Quiche is fantastic.
- Their coffees are on point!
- I keep hearing their Chai is awesome.
(EDIT: It is!)

Customer service by Sam and Anna was fantastic. They know their product and can help you make the best choice for your craving needs.

I can't say enough good things about Coffee Republic.

This is a place, you have to experience!
Amazing coffee place with great vibes. Baked items are on point and all the drinks are really great. Staff was so nice!

Great to have a coffee option in Ballantyne Village. The coffee is very good and the food looks delicious (have not had any yet).  The service is great  - always helpful. I wish their menu had the calorie count on the menu - that's the one drawback.  They have a cute interior space (upstairs and downstairs and outside seating).Also, their reward program seems to be very generous and they have pop-up free coffee (ie.when it's raining or cold).  Give them a try.

I'm in town for the week for work, and am staying at the AC Hotel across the parking lot from Coffee Republic, and it caught my eye as somewhere I could pop in to as I come and go. Today I stopped in on my way back to the hotel and I'm quite happy I did. The coffee and the danish I got hit the spot. My only regret is that I didn't notice the shop earlier in the week. Any time I'm in town for work, I now have a trusty place to pop in to, especially if I'm staying at the AC Hotel, because it's super convenient, just a few seconds walk across the parking lot.

Now if only they were bold enough to open a location in Minnesota...
Love the ube latte with matcha a lot!
Clean, friendly staff, excellent quiche- loved my vanilla latte!! Can't wait to come back!

I really don't know how to explain this but feel I need to leave a review. Coffee is always pretty good but service well.. Every time I order a food item it seems that people that order about 4-5 behind me get their items before I do and then I have to ask to get my item almost every single time. There's never a "I'm sorry, have a good day or a thank you" from certain people working there. At this point the personality from the person made me decide not to go back. There really needs to be a better flow or system in place. One of the other customers got so confused cause we didn't even know who's food item was who's so we had to open it up and check. Sadly won't be returning but hopefully this issue gets better. Service and personality go such a long way!

If I could give this review 12 stars I would! Molly and Samantha do such an amazing job along with the other staff members. Molly and Sam Help me usually when I'm in between clients and come downstairs for a mid afternoon coffee and muffin pick me up! I recommend Their iced salty dog and French toast muffin! You won't be disappointed!
Coffee republic has become my favorite local coffee shops! I come often and every time I walk in the staff is so welcoming. Molly and Sam are literally the best!

I have had a great experience every time I have visited this location! Everyone is always super nice, especially Molly. She is super attentive, makes suggestions based on your preferences, and always has a smile on her face and cheery disposition. Every drink she has made me so far has been delicious :) Highly recommend this place whenever you need a quick pick-me-up or a bite to eat, their pastries are also very good! Cute place with friendly people and a positive atmosphere.

It's a very cute spot with a ton of fun drinks and the pasties looked good. Though I did think it was weird that they have food but don't have a menu online or have a menu in store, when I asked the cashier said we have sandwiches and burritos which doesn't exactly help. When I asked for a menu she said they used to have a physical one in store but not sure where it was....one physical menu is a little strange for a whole shop. The coffee was decent, probably won't be going back again.

Coffee Republic has quickly become one of my favorite coffee shops in the Ballantyne area! I have been here on multiple occasions, and every time, without fail, the staff has been welcoming and super friendly! They are more than willing to answer any questions you might have, and make the orders quickly. I enjoy the baked goods they offer, and the atmosphere is inviting and modern. If you are looking to support local shops, then look no further because Coffee Republic is a standout. Compared to some of the other shops around here, the pricing is not terrible, and the service and quality of the food/drinks separates from "your average coffee shop"!

Coffee Republic is a cute coffee shop! their espresso is rich and delicious, and they have so many amazing drink choices. The food is also very good. I love the quiche. Molly is an amazing barista and has great recommendations!

I always want to support local and shop small! However up charging $.1.30 for oat milk is inane! Then, to not receive even a full cup of coffee; for $8.30 is even more insane. When I asked for a full cup of milk but then, didn't balance it back out with the appropriate about of flavor! It was not worth it and I will not be back!
Molly is amazing!! She truly is the best barista here always helps me with my orders and goes above and beyond with service, she's great!

$1.20 for an alternative milk. That's the whole carton at Trader Joes. This place is a rip off. And $1.00 for a flavor?! The syrup in the restaurant bulk grocery store is like $6 for BULK. This is outrageous. NYC isn't even this expensive.

My wife and I have given this place a try a handful of times. After our first visit, I would have given them 5 stars. The coffee was good and the service was great! Every time we have been in since then has just gone progressively down hill. The coffee is still pretty decent but the wait continues to get longer and longer it seems. They only ever have 1 barista making drinks and 1 other employee taking orders and making food and it's just too busy for them to keep up with. There does not seem to be any system in place for mobile ordering, they keep the drinks behind the bar so you have to request your mobile order and thus still wait in line to ask for it and then have an awkward conversation with the employee at the counter when it's not ready after you ordered it 15 minutes ago. The staff is all very friendly and doing their best but they need more help!
Cute new coffee spot! Enjoyed the vibes. Had the earl grey latte with an extra pump of lavender and vanilla and it was so delicious  looking forward to coming back and bringing a friend
Had some great coffees and tried a French toast muffin. They both where some of the best I've had in a long time.

I recently visited coffee republic with my daughter and had a fantastic experience. They offer a wide variety of coffee choices, each brewed to perfection. The breakfast sandwiches are delicious and well-prepared, making for a perfect morning treat. Prices are quite reasonable, making it a great value for the quality. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, with good vibes all around. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great start to their day!
Had a great chai latte!!
Great service and atmosphere! Ghost is very cordial and knowledgeable about coffee. Sophie and the other baristas are always in good spirits. Great place to start your day.
Great service and exceptional coffee.  The espresso blend was so smooth.
We had a lovely family coffee break here. Flat white was tasty and I had ci namin twist,also yummy. Great athmosphere. Will visit a lot
Nutty truffle iced is really good. Expensive. Seating is just for looks, unless you're 3ft tall.

I ordered from the coffee republic app. It said it would be ready in 10 minutes. It actually took 40 minutes. Only one person was working. She was friendly. The other employee was taking a lunch break. She was eating right next to us which was unprofessional. When her break ended she walked behind the counter and asked the other employee if she could trade shifts with her next weekend. Several people were waiting on their orders and people were waiting to order. She finally started helping and did not wash her hands. She was not friendly. She didn't seem like she cared. The quiche was runny. The cinnamon twist was hard, dry, and tasteless. I could not even taste the coffee  in the morning buzz latte. I only tasted milk. I was so disappointed. I won't be back.
The coffee was okay, but I will try other stuff they have
Such a yummy coffee spot

Found this place when I was looking for a place to study for my boards. Great atmosphere, staff was super friendly! Food and coffee was delicious! So happy I stumbled upon this place! Super cool vibe!
Cute shop, good coffee, good amount of seating (including some chairs outside)

The coffee and muffin was delicious. The prices were reasonable. The atmosphere was very rustic and welcoming. The only thing I didn't like was the wait. There was only one person making the coffee and it took about 10 minutes. Hopefully they have online ordering soon!
Does not in fact open at 6:30.  Beware fellow early morning commuters!
I really like how they built making it a cozy coffee shop. Welcoming staff and a great coffee. Just need to try other items on the menu. I may become a regular...
energy drinks are soooooo good and the people are so nice.

Best coffee I've ever had!!! They make those lattes with loveeee the syrup is never clumpy it's not too sweet and if you want to switch it up they have energy buzzers instead of coffee!!!!! My favorite is the sweet peach which is seasonal

After placing our order (2 lattes and 2 English muffins) we waited about 15 minutes before we got 1 of the sandwiches. After seeing others who ordered after us receive their drinks (10 minutes) I went back to the cashier to ask for an update on our order. The cashier  pointed behind them and dismissively said "we're working on it." After waiting another 10 minutes my husband walked up to the same cashier and asked for an update. We ended up getting a refund and leaving without the rest of our order. I think it's unfortunate that in 2024, my white husband was given  attention and respect while I, a woman of color, did not receive the same service.
Great coffee, friendly employees.

I am so glad this place opened! The workers are kind and funny! They are great at conversations and the atmosphere is amazing! I am so glad it was added to Ballantyne! The coffee flavors are excellent!
great coffee and the employees are always so kind and friendly
The people here are sooo friendly! There's workspace upstairs and she downstairs. Looking forward to coming back!
This coffee is amazing, and the staff are wonderful!

At 8am, with 20 people in the store, there is one employee trying her best and doing a great job but the wait is out of control. Not the employee's fault. She's great. The ownership is the problem hiring only one person.
Good atmosphere, friendly staff, coffee tastes great!
The Chai Latte is the best I've ever had! The baked items are wonderful and rotate so it is not always the same.
Great coffee and pleasant environment. I loved !!
This place is simply amazing.!!  The best part is that same is a different theme like the rest of the other coffee houses!  Simply AMAZING!!!
Amazing tasting coffee, friendly staff and delicious treats!!!
What an awesome place!  Food, coffee, service and atmosphere can't be beat!  Best coffee experience you can imagine.
Everything from the drinks, to the food, to the customer service is 5 stars!

This place is SO cute & I'm so so happy to have a coffee spot back in ballantyne village! I ordered a lavender haze latte- amazeballs! AND got some macaroons that will absolutely be gone by the end of the day
